etymology.description: 早(早) (zǎo, "early") + 上(上) (shàng, "up; on") together mean "morning". The idea is the early part of the day, when the sun is starting to rise, which corresponds with the concept of 'up' or 'on'.
etymology.interpretation: 早上(早上) (zǎoshang, "morning") reflects the time of day that comes early and signifies the beginning of daily activities when the sun is rising.

examples.chinese: 早上空气清新(早上空氣清新)，适合散步(適合散步)。
examples.english: The morning air is fresh, perfect for a walk.

examples.chinese: 我早上醒来(我早上醒來)，看到窗外日出(看到窗外日出)。
examples.pinyin: wǒ zǎoshang xǐnglái, kàn dào chuāngwài rìchū。
examples.english: I wake up in the morning and see the sunrise outside the window.
